Setting the text label alignment on an Ext.Button component in Ext JS

The following example shows how you can set the text label alignment on an Ext.Button component in Ext JS by setting the textAlign config.

Tags: Ext JS Ext JS 4.1.0 Ext.button.Button Ext.Button button
[example]
© 2012 Sencha Inc. 
/*global Ext:false */
Ext.onReady(function () {
    Ext.create('Ext.Container', {
        id:'container',
        items: [
            Ext.create('Ext.Button', {
                text: 'textAlign: left',
                textAlign: 'left',
                width: 240,
                height: 50,
                style: 'margin: 5px'
            }), // create()
            
            Ext.create('Ext.Button', {
                text: 'textAlign: center (default)',
                textAlign: 'center',
                width: 240,
                height: 50
            }), // create()
            
            Ext.create('Ext.Button', {
                text: 'textAlign: right',
                textAlign: 'right',
                width: 240,
                height: 50,
                style: 'margin: 5px'
            }) // create()
        ], // items
        renderTo: Ext.getBody()
    }); // create()
}); // onReady()
